meanings.definition: The act of acquiring knowledge or skill through reading, research, or practice.
meanings.sent1: Studying for my test helped me learn new things.
meanings.sent2: She spends hours studying every day to improve her grades.
meanings.sent3: I was so focused on studying that I accidentally read the same page three times!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a library, studying each book of information with care.
meanings.sent5: The student's dedication to studying was evident in the vast array of books on the desk.

meanings.definition: The act of examining closely or carefully.
meanings.sent1: His studying of the map revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent2: The detective's studying of the evidence led to a breakthrough in the case.
meanings.sent3: She was caught studying the painting in the museum for an unusually long time.
meanings.sent4: The scientist's studying of the cells under the microscope uncovered a new discovery.
meanings.sent5: The artist's studying of the landscape resulted in a breathtaking masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The act of applying oneself to learning.
meanings.sent1: Her studying paid off when she aced the exam.
meanings.sent2: Studying requires dedication and effort to succeed.
meanings.sent3: He was so engrossed in studying that he forgot about dinner.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's studying of the game strategies helped the team win.
meanings.sent5: The student's studying of different languages broadened their understanding of the world.
